1.brief: the chief matter, a sum of money
1.long: (a) the chief matter, the main point, (b) a sum of money.

1.brief: but, on the other hand, and
1.long: a weak adversative particle, generally placed second in its clause; but, on the other hand, and.

1.long: on, to, against, on the basis of, at.

(a) trans: I make to sit; I set, appoint, (b) intrans: I sit down, am seated, stay.

1.brief: on the right hand, right hand, right
1.long: on the right hand, right hand, right.
a (king's) throne, seat; meton: power, dominion; a potentate.
heaven, (a) the visible heavens: the atmosphere, the sky, the starry heavens, (b) the spiritual heavens.

2.long: set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred.
a minister, servant, of an official character; of priests and Levites.
a tent, booth, tabernacle, abode, dwelling, mansion, habitation.
true (lit: made of truth), real, genuine.

2.brief: a man, one of the human race

3.long: all, the whole, every kind of.
into, in, unto, to, upon, towards, for, among.

any one, some one, a certain one or thing.

4.long: an untranslatable particle, generally answered by "de", each of the two introducing a clause intended to be contrasted with the other.

4.brief: on, to, against, on the basis of, at

the earth, soil, land, region, country, inhabitants of a region.
neither, nor, not even, and not.

4.brief: an untranslatable word that makes a statement contingent
4.long: an untranslatable word (under the circumstances, in that case, anyhow), the general effect of which is to make a statement contingent, which would otherwise be definite: it is thus regularly used with the subjunctive mood.
a priest, one who offers sacrifice to a god (in Jewish and pagan religions; of Christians only met.).
(a) I bring to, (b) characteristically: I offer (of gifts, sacrifices, etc).

4.brief: down from, against, according to, throughout, during
4.long: gen: against, down from, throughout, by; acc: over against, among, daily, day-by-day, each day, according to, by way of.

usage, custom, law; in NT: of law in general, plur: of divine laws; of a force or influence impelling to action; of the Mosaic law; meton: of the books which contain the law, the Pentateuch, the Old Testament scriptures in general.

5.long: whosoever, whichsoever, whatsoever.
(a) a figure, copy, (b) an example, model.
and, even, also, namely.

the, the definite article.

(originally: I transact business), (a) act. of God: I warn; pass: I am warned by God (probably in response to an inquiry as to one's duty), (b) (I take a name from my public business, hence) I receive a name, am publicly called.
Moses; met: the books of Moses, the Pentateuch.
